item.title: Of Code Smells and Hygiene
item.description: On Abstractions If you find yourself adding more parameters and if-statements to an existing abstraction, is the abstraction still apt? Why not remove the old abstraction and re-extract a new [more apt] abstraction? Devs frequently succumb to the sunken cost fallacy thinking that there must have been a reason that the code was written in a certain way. References The Wrong Abstraction. Sandi Metz. https://www.sandimetz.com/blog/2016/1/20/the-wrong-abstraction . https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23739596 .
